body:
`WriteReply` creates and triggers a `HTTPEvent` which I didn't want in a unit test :)

More generally: some decoupling from `libevent` wouldn't hurt in `HTTPRequest`. For example, notice that `HTTPRequest::~HTTPRequest` calls `WriteReply(â¦)` (by default) :)
style-nit: Could add a newline after `:` to save some whitespace
diff_hunk:
@@ -510,8 +510,8 @@ void HTTPEvent::trigger(struct timeval* tv)
     else
         evtimer_add(ev, tv); // trigger after timeval passed
 }
-HTTPRequest::HTTPRequest(struct evhttp_request* _req) : req(_req),
-                                                       replySent(false)
+HTTPRequest::HTTPRequest(struct evhttp_request* _req, bool _replySent) : req(_req),
+                                                                         replySent(_replySent)
